section.heading: Minimum requirements of game of skill machines.

para.text: Every game of skill machine offered for play shall first be tested and approved pursuant to this title and rules issued pursuant to this title.
The Office shall utilize the services of an accredited independent outside testing laboratory to test and assess each game of skill machine.
The applicant shall be responsible for paying the fees associated with testing the game of skill machines.
Every game of skill machine offered in the District shall meet the minimum standards approved by the Office, including that a game of skill machine:
Conform to all requirements of federal law and regulations, including the Federal Communications Commission's Class A emissions standards;
Pay out a mathematically demonstrable percentage during the expected lifetime of the machine of all amounts played, which shall not be less than 80%;
Display an accurate representation of the game outcome;

Not automatically alter pay tables or any function of the game of skill machine based on an internal computation of a hold percentage or have a means of manipulation that affects the random selection process or probabilities of winning a game;
Not be negatively affected by static discharge or other electromagnetic interference;
Be capable of displaying the following during idle status: "power reset"; "door open"; or "door closed";
Be able to detect and display the game's complete play history and winnings for the previous 10 games;
Not have a theoretical payback percentage capable of being changed without making a hardware or software change in the machine itself;
Be designed so that the replacement of parts or modules required for normal maintenance does not necessitate replacement of the electromechanical meters;
Contain a non-resettable meter that shall be located in a locked area of the machine that is accessible only by a key;
Be capable of storing the meter information required by paragraph (10) of this subsection for a minimum of 180 days after a power loss to the machine;
Have accounting software that keeps an electronic record that includes:
Total cash inserted into the game of skill machine;
The value of winning tickets awarded to players by the game of skill machine;
The total credits played on the game of skill machine;
The total credits awarded by the game of skill machine; and
The payback percentage credited to players of the game of skill machine;
Be linked to a centralized accounting system that will allow the Office to activate or deactivate the game of skill machine from the centralized system remotely; and
Be linked to a centralized accounting system in accordance with section 414 by which all approved game of skill machines shall be connected for the purposes set forth in section 414.
The CFO may issue rules to establish additional licensing and registration requirements.
